English (United States)(en-US): You’re here!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 드디어 왔구나!

English (United States)(en-US): You look like you’re\nin a good mood, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 오늘 기분 좋아 보이네.

English (United States)(en-US): Anything special happen?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무슨 일 있었어?

English (United States)(en-US): Listen, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 들어 봐, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Did you know there are dreams\nthat don’t disappear?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사라지지 않는 꿈이 존재한다는 거 알아?

English (United States)(en-US): Dreams that don’t disappear?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사라지지 않는 꿈?

English (United States)(en-US): What do you mean?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 무슨 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): She was really living on in her dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그녀는 정말로 꿈 속에서 살아가고 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Dream-smelling and dream-caressing\nalongside her dream-people.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈의 냄새를 맡고, 꿈의 표면을\n만지면서, 꿈속 사람들과 함께.

English (United States)(en-US): Her dream forever waits\nfor her in the same spot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그녀의 꿈은 영원히 한 자리에서\n그녀를 기다리고 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): It became infinite, continuing\nlong after the night ends.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 밤이 지나도 잊히지 않는 무한한 꿈이 된 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, I discovered what humans call\nthis kind of dream in an encyclopedia.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 사전을 찾아서 인간들이 그런\n꿈을 뭐라고 부르는지 알게 됐어.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘Lucid dream.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘루시드 드림’... 또는 ‘자각몽’.

English (United States)(en-US): Never heard of it.|Sounds familiar.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 처음 들어 봐.|몇 번 들어 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): Living on within a dream... It’s hard to believe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈속에서 살아갈 수 있다니... 믿기 힘드네.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I have a favor to ask.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 부탁하고 싶은 게 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): How about picking up ‘lucid dreaming,’\nlike the human I mentioned?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 말한 인간처럼, <nickname>도 ‘자각몽’을\n연습해 보는 거 어때?

English (United States)(en-US): If you recognize me even after I become a\ndream, and stay inside me, I won’t disappear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 꿈이 된 나를 알아보고 계속 내 안에\n머무른다면, 나는 사라지지 않을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll try my best, too. Magnificent food, a cozy\nhome, and delightful humans just for you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 노력할게. 황홀하게 맛있는 음식,\n편안한 집, 친절한 인간들을 만들어 줄게!

English (United States)(en-US): You’ll be happy inside me...\nforever and ever.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 내 안에서 영원히 행복할 수 있도록.

English (United States)(en-US): I want to stay with you for\nas long as I can, too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 너와 오래 함께하고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): But...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만...

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t think that’s a good idea.|It’s not possible.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내겐 현실에 존재하는 것들도 소중해.|불행해질 현실을 감당할 자신이 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): ...Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 친구들, 가족들, 나의 꿈을 위해\n달려온 시간들. 그리고 내 자신까지.

English (United States)(en-US): My life matters to me too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무리 꿈속 세상에 비해 보잘것없어\n보일지라도... 나의 현실인 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): ...Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 아닌 현실이기에\n더욱 소중한 법이라고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): Reality matters to me too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈에서 깨어나는 순간마다 점점\n더 보잘것없어지는 현실을 보며

English (United States)(en-US): If I were to live within a dream, I’d have\nto leave behind so much in the real world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 점점 무너질 거야. 감당할 자신이\n없어서 더욱 꿈에 매달리겠지.
그게 나의 현실을 망가뜨린다는 걸 알면서도.

English (United States)(en-US): But that human loved her\ndream more than her reality.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지만... 그 인간은 현실보다 꿈을 더 사랑하고 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve never seen someone like that.\nSomeone so in love with her dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 깨지 않는 꿈과 영원한 현실은 사실상 똑같은 것이 아닐까?

English (United States)(en-US): Her dream offered things\nunattainble in real life.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다만 그녀의 꿈은 현실에서 불가능한 것들을 선사했지.

English (United States)(en-US): Time with her lover, neverending\nwealth, profound honor...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑하는 이와의 시간, 끝없는 환희,\n드높은 부와 명예...

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe it became harder and harder to\nbear a reality with none of those things.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 모든 게 누락된 현실을 견디기 어려웠기에,\n꿈을 사랑할 수밖에 없던 건 아닐까?

English (United States)(en-US): ...You mean the human chose\nto stay in a fantasy—her dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈속에 머물다. 현실에서... 도망치다?\n아냐, 아냐. 아냐. 내 말을 들어 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): Living within an plentiful fantasy\nmay be meaningful in its own way.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. 충만한 환상 속에서 살아가는\n것도 나름의 의미가 있을지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): It may be the only solution,\na last resort for her.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 길이 자신을 위한 유일한 해결책일\n수도, 최후의 보루일 수도 있잖아. 응?

English (United States)(en-US): Of course.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 물론 그럴 수도 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): But I’ve been thinking, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 생각해 봤는데, 뭉치...

English (United States)(en-US): A fantasy will never be anything more.|It’s okay to linger for just a while.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 환상은 환상일 뿐이야.|잠시 환상에 머무르는 것도 괜찮을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s not real. It has no depth.\nIt’s fiction, made by you or others.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 환상에는 실체가 없는걸. 쌓아 올린 게\n아니야. 주어졌거나, 만들어 낸 거지.

English (United States)(en-US): And some day it will all go up in smoke,\nwith no guarantee of what will be left.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 불안정한 환상은 언젠가 모습을 감출 거고,\n그 뒤에 무엇이 남을지는 장담할 수 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): Residing in one’s made-up fantasy\nseems like an acceptable choice.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 위안과 활력을 가져다 줄 수도 있을 테고,\n숨을 돌릴 틈이 되어 주기도 하겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): If such a choice brings you relief and\nenergy, I think that’s valuable in itself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 환상이 영원할 거라는 환상을\n조심해야겠지만 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): One should be cautious of fantasizing\nthat a fantasy will last forever, however.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 돌아올 힘을 잃어버리면 안 되니까.

English (United States)(en-US): ...That a fantasy will last forever is fantasy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 환상이 영원할 거라는 것도, 환상.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, then are fantasies mere\nhideouts that are sure to collapse?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 그렇다면 환상은 무너져\n버릴 게 분명한 도피처에 불과할까?

English (United States)(en-US): Would it be foolish to crawl into the\nsweet darkness and never come out?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 영영 달콤한 어둠의 뒤편으로 숨어\n들어가는 건 어리석은 일일까?

English (United States)(en-US): Why should we throw ourselves into harsh\nreality, waiting with its jaws wide open?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어째서 입을 벌린 채 기다리고 있는 잔인한\n현실 속으로 몸을 던져야만 하는 걸까.

English (United States)(en-US): ...I can’t tell, for now. I’ll have to\ndive into the ocean of thoughts.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...당장은 알 수 없겠어. 생각에 잠겨 보는 수밖에.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>. You understand what\nI wish to run away from, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너도 내가 무엇으로부터\n도망치고 싶은지 알겠지?

English (United States)(en-US): To tell you the truth, I am afraid of death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사실은 나 죽음이 두려워.

English (United States)(en-US): When I feel its shadow approaching\nacross time, my entire body recoils.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시간을 가로질러 오는 그것의 그림자가\n느껴질 때면 온몸이 움츠러들어.

English (United States)(en-US): Frightening. It’s so frightening,\nI cannot endure it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무서워, 무서워서, 견디지 못하겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): Have you ever been this frightened?\nEnough to bolt from the spot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 이렇게 무서웠던 것이 있어?\n당장 도망치고 싶었던 적이 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I was.|Not yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 나도 있어.|아직까지는 없었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I was so frightened I wanted to run away when...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 견뎌야만 했어. 피할 길이 없었거든.|두려움을 피해 도망치기도 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): And going through such\nthings, you became stronger.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 공포를 감당한 <nickname>\n너는 정말 강한 인간이구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you for sharing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 도망치는 데에도 용기가 필요하지.\n두 다리를 이끌고 어디론가 가야 하니까.

English (United States)(en-US): But I completely understand how you feel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 뭉치의 마음은 충분히 이해해.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t wholeheartedly believe\nyour words, but thank you nonetheless.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 말을 온전히 믿을 수는 없겠지만, 고마워.

English (United States)(en-US): But there is still a horrendous\nshadow cast in front of me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데... 여전히 내 앞엔 참혹한\n그림자가 드리워져 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Speaking of shadows... When you encounter a\nproblem, do you tend to avoid it or confront it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 말인데... 너는 문제를 맞닥뜨릴 때 회피하는\n편이야, 아니면 직면하는 편이야?

English (United States)(en-US): I avoid it.|I confront it, if possible.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 일단 회피하는 편이야.|가능하다면 직면하는 편이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Avoiding is necessary sometimes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 때로는 회피도 필요하다고 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): Would you mind if I borrow a\nbit of your courage, <nickname>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>의 용기를 빌리고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s still difficult for me to face death...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 아직 죽음을 마주하기 어렵거든...

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, you said that all humans know\nthey’ll die someday, yet don’t fully realize it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 지구의 인간들은 모두 언젠가 죽는다는\n걸 알면서도 실감하지 않고 살아간다고 했지?

English (United States)(en-US): Should I live like that? I’ll spend my days laughing\nwith you, then one day close my eyes peacefully.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 그러면 어떨까? 지금처럼 너와 웃고, 대화하고,\n그러다 평화롭게 눈을 감는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I could be born as your dream\na long, long time later.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 오랜 시간이 지난 그때\n너의 꿈으로 태어나면 되잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps once I reflect enough,\nI won’t be afraid of death anymore.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 충분한 시간을 사색으로 물들이고 나면, 더는\n지금과 같이 죽음이 두렵지 않을지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah! Maybe fear will grow old and frail\nand won’t be able to hurt me then.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아! 어쩌면 낡고 쇠한 두려움이\n더 이상 날 해치지 못할지도.

English (United States)(en-US): That would make me happy. But...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 나는 기쁘겠지만...

English (United States)(en-US): You’ve longed to become a dream. Are you sure\nyou want to live like that with no end in sight?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 너는 꿈이 되기를 손꼽아왔잖아.\n그렇게 기약 없는 시간을 보내도 괜찮겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes! Sure!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응! 물론이지!

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll wake up like any other day, say hello\nto my mold, and look out the window.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 여느 때처럼 일어나 내 곰팡이와\n인사하고 창 밖을 내려다볼 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll hide among humans\nand observe them quietly!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들 사이에 숨어들어\n조용히 그들을 관찰할 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): Then I’ll come back, discuss my\nfindings with you, and fill out my diary.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 돌아와 <nickname>, 너와 대화하고,\n내 일기장을 가득 채울 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): At times it will hurt. Sharp confusion\nand pitch-black hate will sometimes crawl in.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괴로움도 있겠지. 이따금 송곳 같은 혼란과\n새까만 혐오감이 기어들어 오고는 하니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah... but if I could stay here,\nI would gladly welcome them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아... 내가 여기에 남아 있을 수만 있다면\n그것들조차 관대하게 맞이할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Day after day, season after\nseason, for a very long time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 매일매일, 계절이 수백 번 바뀌도록, 아주 오랫동안.

English (United States)(en-US): Until I forget what a dream is...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 무엇인지조차 잊을 정도로...

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot seems to be hiding something.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치가 무엇인가를 숨기고 있는 것만 같아.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Should I ask? Or should I\nwait for them to bring it up?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (무슨 일인지 물어볼까?\n스스로 말할 수 있도록 묵인할까?)

English (United States)(en-US): ...Is something going on?|...I’m glad to hear it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...혹시 무슨 일 있어?|...그렇다면 다행이야.

English (United States)(en-US): No. This is what the average Dot looks like.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 리가. 지극히 보통의 뭉치야.

English (United States)(en-US): You can be honest with me.\nI only want to help.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 솔직하게 말해 주면 좋겠어. 널 돕고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m glad we’re going to be\ntogether for a long time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치와 오래도록 함께 할 수 있게 되어서.

English (United States)(en-US): O, Okay...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그, 그래...

English (United States)(en-US): ... You know. Being dishonest is like trapping\nyou inside a fantasy that will one day shatter.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 있지, 널 속이는 건 어쩌면, 너를 영원하지\n못할 환상 속에 가두는 것과 같을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): The fantasy I can give you is safe and\nsound. It’s more peaceful than a dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 네게 선사할 수 있는 환상은 안전하고\n부드러워. 꿈만큼... 아니. 꿈보다 평화롭지.

English (United States)(en-US): So much so that it’s hard to\nbelieve it will shatter someday.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언젠가 깨질 거라 믿기 힘들 만큼.

English (United States)(en-US): On the other hand, the truth that has hit\nme, the reality, may make even you writhe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 반면에 내게 닥친 진실은, 그러니까 현실은,\n너조차 몸부림치게 할지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): Now, do you still want to undo\nthe ribbon of this ominous gift?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 이 불길한 선물의 리본을 풀어 보고 싶어?

English (United States)(en-US): Of course.|I’m a little hesitant...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 물론이지.|좀 망설여지는데...

English (United States)(en-US): But I still want to know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 여전히 알고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): How come?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어째서?

English (United States)(en-US): It will hurt more when the fantasy shatters.|Ignoring reality will only make my fears grow.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 환상이 깨졌을 때의 아픔이 더 클 테니까.|현실을 외면하는 동안 두려움만 커질 테니까.

English (United States)(en-US): If you believe everything will be fine and\nsolve nothing, you may be happy for a while.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 다 괜찮을 거라 믿고 무엇도 해결하지\n않으면, 그동안은 여전히 행복할 수도 있겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): But when the fairytale fantasy shatters...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 끝내 거짓말 같은 환상이 깨지고 나면...

English (United States)(en-US): There will be nothing left for me.\nNot even an opportunity to choose.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그때 내게 남아 있는 건 무엇도\n없을 거야. 선택할 기회조차도.

English (United States)(en-US): Now that I’ve heard what you’ve said, I can’t\nwander within the fantasy lightheartedly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이미 네 말을 듣게 된 이상, 마음\n편히 환상 속을 거닐 수는 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): I wouldn’t be able to make a choice\nif I don’t know the problem at hand.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리에게 닥친 문제를 알지 못하니\n선택을 내리지도 못하게 되겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): I would simply be looking around\nand shaking, incessantly...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그저 바라보며 떨고 있을 거야. 하염없이...

English (United States)(en-US): Yes... Like I am right now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래... 지금의 나처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you, <nickname>. I have a vague\nidea of what the answer might be.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고마워, <nickname>. 어렴풋이 답을 알 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): First, I should come clean.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우선은 너에게 모두 털어놓아야겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): The truth is, from the day I learned dreams\ninevitably disappear, my body started changing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실은, 꿈이 사라질 수밖에 없다는 걸\n알게 된 날부터 몸이 이상했어.

English (United States)(en-US): It started getting lighter, like\na balloon being blown up.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 붕 떠오르듯이, 흩어지듯이, 조금씩 조금씩,

English (United States)(en-US): As if it were floating,\nor dissolving, little by little.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 부풀어 오르는 풍선처럼 가벼워지고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): What do you mean? Dot, are you ill?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 무슨 뜻이야? 뭉치, 아픈 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): No, not like that...\nIt can’t be fixed. I can tell.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 그런 게 아니야... 고칠 수\n있는 게 아니야. 저절로 알 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Something’s wrong with the life force\nthat the Moon Beings gave me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 이들이 선물해 준 생명력에 이상이 생긴 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Or maybe my given time\nwas never long to begin with.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니면 나에게 주어진 시간이\n원래부터 그리 길지 않았거나.

English (United States)(en-US): You said dreams are destined to\nbe forgotten on Earth. Right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 꿈은 지구에서 망각의\n속성을 가졌다고 말했었지?

English (United States)(en-US): Although I’m made up of worthless odds\nand ends, dreams and I may be a little alike.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 보잘것없는 찌꺼기에 불과할지라도,\n나 조금은 꿈을 닮았나 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): If I can’t fully become a dream,\nI may end up a pile of ashes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 완전한 꿈이 되지 못한다면... 머지않아\n재가 되어 사라져 버릴지도 모르겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): No, it can’t be. You don’t know\nthat yet. We’ll find a way.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아냐, 아닐 거야. 아직 확실하지\n않잖아. 같이 방법을 찾아보자.

English (United States)(en-US): Talking to you made me realize.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 대화하면서 비로소 직감했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Fanciful methods such as lucid\ndreams can’t keep me alive.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 루시드 드림과 비슷한, 허황된 방법\n같은 걸로 나를 살려 둘 수 없다는걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Rather, clinging to such illusions\nmight make me lose everything.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오히려 그 위험한 환상에 매달려\n많은 걸 잃게 될지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t want to remain in an unstable,\nbreakable fantasy anymore.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 깨질 듯 불안한 환상 속에 있는 건 이제 멈추려 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Does that mean you will\nbecome a dream right away?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면... 당장 꿈이 되겠다는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Or that you will wait for death as you are?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니면 이대로 죽음을 기다리겠다는 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t know...yet. I’m still confused.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아직은... 잘 모르겠어. 여전히 혼란스러워.

English (United States)(en-US): One thing is for sure, though.\nI will no longer crouch and hide.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 확실한 건, 더는 숨어서\n웅크리고 있지 않을 거라는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Until now, I wasn’t ready to choose.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이전까지는 선택할 준비가 안 됐었어.

English (United States)(en-US): To look death in the eye,\nand inch closer to it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음을 똑바로 바라보고,\n그것에 가까이 다가갈 준비가.

English (United States)(en-US): I speculated from afar and\ntrembled at everything in fear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 멀리서 짐작하고 막연히 두려워하기만 했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Now I won’t push aside thoughts of death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제는 죽음에 대한 생각을 마다하지 않을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Even if it puts me on the road\nto more pain and agony...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 설령 그것이 더 아프고 괴로워지는 길이라고 해도...

English (United States)(en-US): I will gladly march into reality,\nlurking with the dark farewell.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 기꺼이 어두운 이별이 도사리는\n현실 속으로 걸어 들어갈 거야.
